oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Charley Pride, Wayne Kemp and Mack Vickery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interviews of Charley Pride (performer), Wayne Kemp (performer), and Mack Vickery (perfromer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Recordings are from November 18, 1970.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Charley Pride; Wayne Kemp; Mack Vickery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Keep on Walking (Brian Collins) -- (01:42) Ralph Emery radio spot commercial for Roadway Center Truck Stop -- (02:40) Emery and Charley Pride discuss Pride's international tour possibilities -- (03:35) Emery invites Pride to retell a story about when he met Webb Pierce -- (08:59) Pride discusses his leg getting run over during a time where he was auditioning for the Major League; additionally Pride reflects on attempting to meet Casey Stengel at three in the morning -- (13:44) Emery inquires about if joining the Mets was the last attempt Pride made to make the Major League -- (17:47) Come on Home and Sing the Blues to Daddy (Charley Pride) -- (20:05) Mr. D. C. radio spot commercial hosted by an unknown voice -- (21:09) Emery introduces Johnny Cash -- (21:17) Come Along and Ride This Train (Johnny Cash) -- (21:59) Unidentified announcer announces Cash's Come Along and Ride This Train: Live at the Grand Ole Opry -- (22:14) Emery introduces Wayne Kemp, and both discuss the characters that emerged from the Badlands of Oklahoma -- (24:00) Who'll Turn Out the Lights (Wayne Kemp) -- (26:42) WSM commercial break hosted by an unidentified voice -- (27:03) Emery invites Pride and Kemp to discuss their time together at the Panther Hall while recording "Image of Me" -- (29:36) Image of Me (Charley Pride) -- (32:11) Emery reflects on Tommy Collins influence on an episode of the Porter Wagoner Show -- (32:27) Emery introduces Pride's Christmas album, and both discuss their ability to get into the Christmas spirit -- (34:32) Emery inquires about the difference in African-American's perception of Christmas; additionally, Emery inquires about Pride's children's reaction to see their father dressed up as Christmas -- (36:57) Emery and Pride discuss Pride's father, Mach Pride, and Pride getting honored in Jackson, Mississippi -- (39:41) Santa and the Kids [featuring Emery voiceover] (Charley Pride) -- (41:39) WSM radio spot commercial for the Grand Ole Opry hosted by an unidentified voice -- (41:52) Emery introduces Mack Vickery, and invites him to do a John Wayne impression -- (43:46) Emery inquires as to how Vickery gained his Wayne impression -- (44:43) Emery invites Vickery to discuss his live album at an Alabama women's prison -- (47:46) Life Turned Her That Way (Mack Vickery) -- (50:39) Emery invites Vickery to discuss the subject of live albums -- (52:57) Cummins radio spot commercial hosted by Linda Gill -- (53:54) I Can't Believe That You Stopped Loving Me [featuring Ralph Emery voiceover] (Charley Pride)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Kemp, Wayne, 1941-; Pride, Charley; Pride, Charley, 1938-; Vickery, Mack;
